alert.note: Alert for Southern Middlesex; Southern New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued March 04 at 10:15AM EST until March 04 at 12:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southern Middlesex and Southern New London Counties. * WHEN...Until noon EST today. * COASTAL IMPACTS...Widespread flooding of vulnerable areas is expected near the waterfront and shoreline, including roads, parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront. Road closures are likely, and vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays, and heavy rain could exacerbate flooding problems in those areas. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of at least 2 to 4 feet will result in beach erosion, with wave splashover exacerbating flooding of shoreline roads and properties. Localized minor damage to shoreline structures is possible. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NEW HAVEN HARBOR AT NEW HAVEN CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 8.7 FT, MODERATE 9.3 FT, MAJOR 10.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/09 AM 9.9/10.4 3.2/ 3.7 3.7/ 4.2 3 MODERATE 04/10 PM 6.1/ 6.6 -0.7/-0.2 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE 05/10 AM 7.2/ 7.7 0.5/ 1.0 1.0/ 1.5 1 NONE 05/10 PM 5.9/ 6.4 -0.9/-0.4 -0.2/ 0.3 1 NONE 06/11 AM 5.7/ 6.2 -1.1/-0.6 -0.7/-0.2 1 NONE 06/11 PM 5.9/ 6.4 -0.9/-0.4 -0.2/ 0.2 0-1 NONE THAMES RIVER AT NEW LONDON CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.1 FT, MODERATE 6.1 FT, MAJOR 7.9 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/07 AM 5.9/ 6.4 2.7/ 3.2 3.5/ 4.0 3-4 MODERATE 04/06 PM 2.7/ 3.2 -0.5/ 0.0 0.9/ 1.4 2 NONE 05/08 AM 3.9/ 4.4 0.8/ 1.3 1.4/ 1.9 1 NONE 05/08 PM 2.6/ 3.1 -0.6/-0.1 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE 06/09 AM 2.3/ 2.8 -0.8/-0.2 -0.2/ 0.2 1 NONE 06/09 PM 2.5/ 3.0 -0.7/-0.2 0.0/ 0.5 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
